view, it might well retreat from the communications area and leave it to

America is to have a truly alternative supplementary service, it is not believed#

The NAEB therefore is both confident of the future, and proud of its last
few years and months as it respectfully submits herewith, its reports and reÂ¬
quests, and expresses, once again, its sincere appreciation for the support and
understanding of the W. K. Kellogg Foundation.
Respectfully submitted on behalf of
President Graydon Ausmus and the
NAEB Board of Directors
H. J. Skornia
Executive Director
June 22, 1954
Urbana, Illinois
